parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (CMF 11240002) at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for tracking and reporting campaign finance.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions Valeriu Iftime, president of PNL Botoșani, and encourages voters to support the PNL team in the parliamentary elections.  It also lists other candidates: Eduard Mititelu, Buliga Luciana, Dumitriu Alexandru, #Jitaru_Ovidiu and Ionela Aiftincă. This directly refers to specific candidates participating in the parliamentary elections, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide audience within specific locations in Botoșani County, Romania, as evidenced by the `aaa_info` section specifying numerous cities and towns. This clearly addresses the wide population, not just personal communication.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post is to persuade voters in Botoșani County to vote for Valeriu Iftime's PNL team in the parliamentary elections. Phrases like "voteze, duminică, 1 decembrie, echipa PNL," and "Duminică, 1 decembrie, votăm #EchipaValeriuIftime" explicitly urge voters to support a specific party and its candidates. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it promotes a specific political party and its candidates, advocating for their election.  It's clearly promotional material, not journalistic.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a direct call to action to vote for a specific political party and its candidates. The language used is persuasive and promotional, not reflective of a personal viewpoint.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>884598480552277</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to specific parliamentary candidates (Valeriu Iftime and others from PNL), targets a wide audience in Botoșani County through a paid Facebook advertisement, and has the clear electoral objective of influencing voters to support the PNL team. The presence of a CMF number further reinforces this conclusion.  There are no counterarguments to suggest otherwise.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Valeriu Iftime</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Eduard Mititelu</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Buliga Luciana</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Dumitriu Alexandru</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Jitaru Ovidiu</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>Ionela Aiftincă</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>PNL</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Vocea Dorohoi, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 884598480552277) care constituie propagandă electorală pentru alegerile parlamentare, promovând explicit candidații PNL Valeriu Iftime, Eduard Mititelu, Buliga Luciana, Dumitriu Alexandru, Jitaru Ovidiu și Ionela Aiftincă, prin îndemnuri directe la vot ("votăm #EchipaValeriuIftime - echipa PNL de pe prima poziție pe buletinul de vot!") și utilizând un număr CMF (11240002), având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea PNL în județul Botoșani.  Postarea, fiind o reclamă plătită pe o platformă publică, se adresează unui public larg și depășește limitele jurnalismului, conform articolului 36 (7) din LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
